itemDescription: George Cross recipient in World War II

wikipedia_page.main: Captain Douglas Ford  (18 September 1918 – 18 December 1943) was a Royal Scots officer and British prisoner of war in the Second World War, who was posthumously awarded the George Cross for conspicuous gallantry. His citation was published in the London Gazette on 18 March 1946.

response: *Douglas Ford (British Army officer) (1918–1943), British Army officer awarded the George Cross
